accel_to_decel_enable.label: Enable accel_to_decel
accel_to_decel_enable.tooltip: Klipper's max_accel_to_decel will be adjusted automatically

accel_to_decel_factor.label: accel_to_decel
accel_to_decel_factor.tooltip: Klipper's max_accel_to_decel will be adjusted to this percent of acceleration

additional_cooling_fan_speed.label: Fan speed
additional_cooling_fan_speed.tooltip: Speed of auxiliary part cooling fan. Auxiliary fan will run at this speed during printing except the first several layers which are defined by no cooling layers

apply_scarf_seam_on_circles.label: Scarf Seam On Compensation Circles
apply_scarf_seam_on_circles.tooltip: Scarf seam will be applied on circles for better dimensional accuracy.

auxiliary_fan.label: Auxiliary part cooling fan
auxiliary_fan.tooltip: Enable this option if machine has auxiliary part cooling fan

bed_exclude_area.label: Bed exclude area
bed_exclude_area.tooltip: Unprintable area in XY plane. For example, X1 Series printers use the front left corner to cut filament during filament change. The area is expressed as polygon by points in following format: "XxY, XxY, ..."

bed_temperature_formula.label: Bed temperature type
bed_temperature_formula.tooltip: This option determines how the bed temperature is set during slicing: based on the temperature of the first filament or the highest temperature of the printed filaments.

before_layer_change_gcode.label: Before layer change G-code
before_layer_change_gcode.tooltip: This G-code is inserted at every layer change before lifting z

best_object_pos.label: Best object position
best_object_pos.tooltip: Best auto arranging position in range [0,1] w.r.t. bed shape.

bottom_color_penetration_layers.label: Bottom paint penetration layers
bottom_color_penetration_layers.tooltip: This is  the number of layers of top bottom penetration.

bottom_shell_layers.label: Bottom shell layers
bottom_shell_layers.tooltip: This is the number of solid layers of bottom shell, including the bottom surface layer. When the thickness calculated by this value is thinner than bottom shell thickness, the bottom shell layers will be increased

bottom_shell_thickness.label: Bottom shell thickness
bottom_shell_thickness.tooltip: The number of bottom solid layers is increased when slicing if the thickness calculated by bottom shells layers is thinner than this value. This can avoid having too thin shell when layer height is small. 0 means that this setting is disabled and thickness of bottom shell is absolutely determained by bottom shell layers

bottom_surface_pattern.label: Bottom surface pattern
bottom_surface_pattern.tooltip: Line pattern of bottom surface infill, not bridge infill

bridge_angle.label: Bridge direction
bridge_angle.tooltip: Bridging angle override. If left to zero, the bridging angle will be calculated automatically. Otherwise the provided angle will be used for external bridges. Use 180°for zero angle.

bridge_flow.label: Bridge flow
bridge_flow.tooltip: Decrease this value slightly(for example 0.9) to reduce the amount of material for bridge, to improve sag

bridge_no_support.label: Don't support bridges
bridge_no_support.tooltip: Don't support the whole bridge area which makes support very large. Bridge usually can be printing directly without support if not very long

bridge_speed.label: Bridge
bridge_speed.tooltip: Speed of bridge and completely overhang wall

brim_object_gap.label: Brim-object gap
brim_object_gap.tooltip: A gap between innermost brim line and object can make brim be removed more easily

brim_type.label: Brim type
brim_type.tooltip: This controls the generation of the brim at outer and/or inner side of models. Auto means the brim width is analysed and calculated automatically.

brim_width.label: Brim width
brim_width.tooltip: Distance from model to the outermost brim line

chamber_temperatures.label: Chamber temperature
chamber_temperatures.tooltip: Higher chamber temperature can help suppress or reduce warping and potentially lead to higher interlayer bonding strength for high temperature materials like ABS, ASA, PC, PA and so on.At the same time, the air filtration of ABS and ASA will get worse.While for PLA, PETG, TPU, PVA and other low temperature materials,the actual chamber temperature should not be high to avoid cloggings, so 0 which stands for turning off is highly recommended

change_filament_gcode.label: Change filament G-code
change_filament_gcode.tooltip: This gcode is inserted when change filament, including T command to trigger tool change

circle_compensation_manual_offset.label: User Customized Offset
circle_compensation_manual_offset.tooltip: If you want to have tighter or looser assemble, you can set this value. When it is positive, it indicates tightening, otherwise, it indicates loosening

close_fan_the_first_x_layers.label: No cooling for the first
close_fan_the_first_x_layers.tooltip: Close all cooling fan for the first certain layers. Cooling fan of the first layer used to be closed to get better build plate adhesion

complete_print_exhaust_fan_speed.label: Fan speed
complete_print_exhaust_fan_speed.tooltip: Speed of exhuast fan after printing completes

cool_plate_temp.label: Other layers
cool_plate_temp.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers except the initial one. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the Cool Plate

cool_plate_temp_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
cool_plate_temp_initial_layer.tooltip: Bed temperature of the initial layer. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the Cool Plate

curr_bed_type.label: Bed type
curr_bed_type.tooltip: Bed types supported by the printer
enum_labels: Smooth PEI Plate / High Temp Plate

default_acceleration.label: Normal printing
default_acceleration.tooltip: The default acceleration of both normal printing and travel except initial layer

default_filament_profile.label: Default filament profile
default_filament_profile.tooltip: Default filament profile when switch to this machine profile

default_nozzle_volume_type.label: Default Nozzle Volume Type
default_nozzle_volume_type.tooltip: Default Nozzle volume type for extruders in this printer

default_print_profile.label: Default process profile
default_print_profile.tooltip: Default process profile when switch to this machine profile

deretraction_speed.label: Deretraction Speed
deretraction_speed.tooltip: Speed for reloading filament into extruder. Zero means the same speed as retraction

detect_floating_vertical_shell.label: Detect floating vertical shells
detect_floating_vertical_shell.tooltip: Detect overhang paths in vertical shells and slow them by bridge speed.

detect_narrow_internal_solid_infill.label: Detect narrow internal solid infill
detect_narrow_internal_solid_infill.tooltip: This option will auto detect narrow internal solid infill area. If enabled, concentric pattern will be used for the area to speed printing up. Otherwise, rectilinear pattern is used defaultly.

detect_overhang_wall.label: Detect overhang wall
detect_overhang_wall.tooltip: Detect the overhang percentage relative to line width and use different speed to print. For 100 percent overhang, bridge speed is used.

detect_thin_wall.label: Detect thin wall
detect_thin_wall.tooltip: Detect thin wall which can't contain two line width. And use single line to print. Maybe printed not very well, because it's not closed loop

during_print_exhaust_fan_speed.label: Fan speed
during_print_exhaust_fan_speed.tooltip: Speed of exhaust fan during printing.This speed will overwrite the speed in filament custom gcode

elefant_foot_compensation.label: Elephant foot compensation
elefant_foot_compensation.tooltip: Shrink the initial layer on build plate to compensate for elephant foot effect

enable_arc_fitting.label: Arc fitting
enable_arc_fitting.tooltip: Enable this to get a G-code file which has G2 and G3 moves. And the fitting tolerance is the same as resolution

enable_circle_compensation.label: Auto circle contour-hole compensation
enable_circle_compensation.tooltip: Expirment feature to compensate the circle holes and circle contour. This feature is used to improve the accuracy of the circle holes and contour within the diameter below 50mm. Only support PLA Basic, PLA CF, PET CF, PETG CF and PETG HF.

enable_overhang_bridge_fan.label: Force cooling for overhang and bridge
enable_overhang_bridge_fan.tooltip: Enable this option to optimize part cooling fan speed for overhang and bridge to get better cooling

enable_overhang_speed.label: Slow down for overhang
enable_overhang_speed.tooltip: Enable this option to slow printing down for different overhang degree

enable_pressure_advance.label: Enable pressure advance
enable_pressure_advance.tooltip: Enable pressure advance, auto calibration result will be overwriten once enabled. Useless for Bambu Printer

enable_prime_tower.label: Enable
enable_prime_tower.tooltip: The wiping tower can be used to clean up the residue on the nozzle and stabilize the chamber pressure inside the nozzle, in order to avoid appearance defects when printing objects.

eng_plate_temp.label: Other layers
eng_plate_temp.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers except the initial one. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the Engineering Plate

eng_plate_temp_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
eng_plate_temp_initial_layer.tooltip: Bed temperature of the initial layer. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the Engineering Plate

ensure_vertical_shell_thickness.label: Ensure vertical shell thickness
ensure_vertical_shell_thickness.tooltip: Add solid infill near sloping surfaces to guarantee the vertical shell thickness (top+bottom solid layers)

exclude_object.label: Exclude objects
exclude_object.tooltip: Enable this option to add EXCLUDE OBJECT command in g-code for klipper firmware printer

extruder_clearance_dist_to_rod.label: Distance to rod
extruder_clearance_dist_to_rod.tooltip: Horizontal distance of the nozzle tip to the rod's farther edge. Used for collision avoidance in by-object printing.

extruder_clearance_height_to_lid.label: Height to lid
extruder_clearance_height_to_lid.tooltip: Distance of the nozzle tip to the lid. Used for collision avoidance in by-object printing.

extruder_clearance_height_to_rod.label: Height to rod
extruder_clearance_height_to_rod.tooltip: Distance of the nozzle tip to the lower rod. Used for collision avoidance in by-object printing.

extruder_clearance_max_radius.label: Max Radius
extruder_clearance_max_radius.tooltip: Max clearance radius around extruder. Used for collision avoidance in by-object printing.

extruder_colour.label: Extruder Color
extruder_colour.tooltip: Only used as a visual help on UI

extruder_printable_height.label: Extruder printable height
extruder_printable_height.tooltip: Maximum printable height of this extruder which is limited by mechanism of printer

extruder_type.label: Type
extruder_type.tooltip: This setting is only used for initial value of manual calibration of pressure advance. Bowden extruder usually has larger pa value. This setting doesn't influence normal slicing

fan_cooling_layer_time.label: Layer time
fan_cooling_layer_time.tooltip: Part cooling fan will be enabled for layers of which estimated time is shorter than this value. Fan speed is interpolated between the minimum and maximum fan speeds according to layer printing time

fan_max_speed.label: Fan speed
fan_max_speed.tooltip: Part cooling fan speed may be increased when auto cooling is enabled. This is the maximum speed limitation of part cooling fan

fan_min_speed.label: Fan speed
fan_min_speed.tooltip: Minimum speed for part cooling fan

filament_change_length.label: Filament ramming length
filament_change_length.tooltip: When changing the extruder, it is recommended to extrude a certain length of filament from the original extruder. This helps minimize nozzle oozing.

filament_colour.label: Color
filament_colour.tooltip: Only used as a visual help on UI

filament_deretraction_speed.label: Deretraction Speed
filament_deretraction_speed.tooltip: Speed for reloading filament into extruder. Zero means the same speed as retraction

filament_diameter.label: Diameter
filament_diameter.tooltip: Filament diameter is used to calculate extrusion in gcode, so it's important and should be accurate

filament_end_gcode.label: End G-code
filament_end_gcode.tooltip: End G-code when finish the printing of this filament

filament_flow_ratio.label: Flow ratio
filament_flow_ratio.tooltip: The material may have volumetric change after switching between molten state and crystalline state. This setting changes all extrusion flow of this filament in gcode proportionally. Recommended value range is between 0.95 and 1.05. Maybe you can tune this value to get nice flat surface when there has slight overflow or underflow

filament_is_support.label: Support material
filament_is_support.tooltip: Support material is commonly used to print support and support interface

filament_long_retractions_when_cut.label: Long retraction when cut(experimental)
filament_long_retractions_when_cut.tooltip: Experimental feature.Retracting and cutting off the filament at a longer distance during changes to minimize purge.While this reduces flush significantly, it may also raise the risk of nozzle clogs or other printing problems.

filament_map_mode.label: filament mapping mode
filament_map_mode.tooltip: filament mapping mode used as plate param

filament_max_volumetric_speed.label: Max volumetric speed
filament_max_volumetric_speed.tooltip: This setting stands for how much volume of filament can be melted and extruded per second. Printing speed is limited by max volumetric speed, in case of too high and unreasonable speed setting. Can't be zero

filament_notes.label: Filament notes
filament_notes.tooltip: You can put your notes regarding the filament here.

filament_pre_cooling_temperature.label: Precooling target temperature
filament_pre_cooling_temperature.tooltip: To prevent oozing, the nozzle temperature will be cooled during ramming. Therefore, the ramming time must be greater than the cooldown time. 0 means disabled.

filament_prime_volume.label: Filament prime volume
filament_prime_volume.tooltip: The volume of material to prime extruder on tower.

filament_ramming_travel_time.label: Travel time after ramming
filament_ramming_travel_time.tooltip: To prevent oozing, the nozzle will perform a reverse travel movement for a certain period after the ramming is complete. The setting define the travel time.

filament_ramming_volumetric_speed.label: Ramming volumetric speed
filament_ramming_volumetric_speed.tooltip: The maximum volumetric speed for ramming, where -1 means using the maximum volumetric speed.

filament_retract_before_wipe.label: Retract amount before wipe
filament_retract_before_wipe.tooltip: The length of fast retraction before wipe, relative to retraction length

filament_retract_lift_above.label: Z hop lower boundary
filament_retract_lift_above.tooltip: Z hop will only come into effect when Z is above this value and is below the parameter: "Z hop upper boundary"

filament_retract_lift_below.label: Z hop upper boundary
filament_retract_lift_below.tooltip: If this value is positive, Z hop will only come into effect when Z is above the parameter: "Z hop lower boundary" and is below this value

filament_retract_when_changing_layer.label: Retract when change layer
filament_retract_when_changing_layer.tooltip: Force a retraction when changes layer

filament_retraction_distances_when_cut.label: Retraction distance when cut
filament_retraction_distances_when_cut.tooltip: Experimental feature.Retraction length before cutting off during filament change

filament_retraction_length.label: Length
filament_retraction_length.tooltip: Some amount of material in extruder is pulled back to avoid ooze during long travel. Set zero to disable retraction

filament_retraction_minimum_travel.label: Travel distance threshold
filament_retraction_minimum_travel.tooltip: Only trigger retraction when the travel distance is longer than this threshold

filament_scarf_gap.label: Scarf slope gap
filament_scarf_gap.tooltip: In order to reduce the visiblity of the seam in closed loop, the inner wall and outer wall are shortened by a specified amount.

filament_scarf_height.label: Scarf start height
filament_scarf_height.tooltip: This amount can be specified in millimeters or as a percentage of the current layer height.

filament_scarf_length.label: Scarf length
filament_scarf_length.tooltip: Length of the scarf. Setting this parameter to zero effectively disables the scarf.

filament_scarf_seam_type.label: Scarf seam type
filament_scarf_seam_type.tooltip: Set scarf seam type for this filament. This setting could minimize seam visibiliy.

filament_shrink.label: Shrinkage
filament_shrink.tooltip:
Enter the shrinkage percentage that the filament will get after cooling (94% if you measure 94mm instead of 100mm). The part will be scaled in xy to compensate. Only the filament used for the perimeter is taken into account.
Be sure to allow enough space between objects, as this compensation is done after the checks.

filament_soluble.label: Soluble material
filament_soluble.tooltip: Soluble material is commonly used to print support and support interface

filament_start_gcode.label: Start G-code
filament_start_gcode.tooltip: Start G-code when start the printing of this filament

filament_vendor.label: Vendor
filament_vendor.tooltip: Vendor of filament. For show only

filament_wipe.label: Wipe while retracting
filament_wipe.tooltip: Move nozzle along the last extrusion path when retracting to clean leaked material on nozzle. This can minimize blob when printing new part after travel

filament_wipe_distance.label: Wipe Distance
filament_wipe_distance.tooltip: Describe how long the nozzle will move along the last path when retracting

filament_z_hop.label: Z hop when retract
filament_z_hop.tooltip: Whenever the retraction is done, the nozzle is lifted a little to create clearance between nozzle and the print. It prevents nozzle from hitting the print when travel moves. Using spiral line to lift z can prevent stringing

filename_format.label: Filename format
filename_format.tooltip: User can self-define the project file name when export

filter_out_gap_fill.label: Filter out tiny gaps
filter_out_gap_fill.tooltip: Filter out gaps smaller than the threshold specified. This setting won't affact top/bottom layers

flush_into_infill.label: Flush into objects' infill
flush_into_infill.tooltip: Purging after filament change will be done inside objects' infills. This may lower the amount of waste and decrease the print time. If the walls are printed with transparent filament, the mixed color infill will be seen outside. It will not take effect, unless the prime tower is enabled.

flush_into_objects.label: Flush into this object
flush_into_objects.tooltip: This object will be used to purge the nozzle after a filament change to save filament and decrease the print time. Colours of the objects will be mixed as a result. It will not take effect, unless the prime tower is enabled.

flush_into_support.label: Flush into objects' support
flush_into_support.tooltip: Purging after filament change will be done inside objects' support. This may lower the amount of waste and decrease the print time. It will not take effect, unless the prime tower is enabled.

flush_multiplier.label: Flush multiplier
flush_multiplier.tooltip: The actual flushing volumes is equal to the flush multiplier multiplied by the flushing volumes in the table.

fuzzy_skin.label: Fuzzy Skin
fuzzy_skin.tooltip: Randomly jitter while printing the wall, so that the surface has a rough look. This setting controls the fuzzy position

fuzzy_skin_point_distance.label: Fuzzy skin point distance
fuzzy_skin_point_distance.tooltip: The average distance between the random points introduced on each line segment

fuzzy_skin_thickness.label: Fuzzy skin thickness
fuzzy_skin_thickness.tooltip: The width within which to jitter. It's adversed to be below outer wall line width

gap_infill_speed.label: Gap infill
gap_infill_speed.tooltip: Speed of gap infill. Gap usually has irregular line width and should be printed more slowly

gcode_add_line_number.label: Add line number
gcode_add_line_number.tooltip: Enable this to add line number(Nx) at the beginning of each G-Code line

gcode_flavor.label: G-code flavor
gcode_flavor.tooltip: What kind of gcode the printer is compatible with

host_type.label: Host Type
host_type.tooltip: Slic3r can upload G-code files to a printer host. This field must contain the kind of the host.

hot_plate_temp.label: Other layers
hot_plate_temp.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers except the initial one. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the High Temp Plate

hot_plate_temp_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
hot_plate_temp_initial_layer.tooltip: Bed temperature of the initial layer. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the High Temp Plate

independent_support_layer_height.label: Independent support layer height
independent_support_layer_height.tooltip: Support layer uses layer height independent with object layer. This is to support customizing z-gap and save print time.This option will be invalid when the prime tower is enabled.

infill_combination.label: Infill combination
infill_combination.tooltip: Automatically Combine sparse infill of several layers to print together to reduce time. Wall is still printed with original layer height.

infill_direction.label: Infill direction
infill_direction.tooltip: Angle for sparse infill pattern, which controls the start or main direction of line

infill_rotate_step.label: Infill rotate step
infill_rotate_step.tooltip: This parameter adds a slight rotation to each layer of infill to create a cross texture.

infill_shift_step.label: Infill shift step
infill_shift_step.tooltip: This parameter adds a slight displacement to each layer of infill to create a cross texture.

infill_wall_overlap.label: Infill/Wall overlap
infill_wall_overlap.tooltip: Infill area is enlarged slightly to overlap with wall for better bonding. The percentage value is relative to line width of sparse infill

initial_layer_acceleration.label: Initial layer
initial_layer_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration of initial layer. Using a lower value can improve build plate adhensive

initial_layer_flow_ratio.label: Initial layer flow ratio
initial_layer_flow_ratio.tooltip: This factor affects the amount of material for the initial layer

initial_layer_infill_speed.label: Initial layer infill
initial_layer_infill_speed.tooltip: Speed of solid infill part of initial layer

initial_layer_print_height.label: Initial layer height
initial_layer_print_height.tooltip: Height of initial layer. Making initial layer height thick slightly can improve build plate adhension

initial_layer_speed.label: Initial layer
initial_layer_speed.tooltip: Speed of initial layer except the solid infill part

initial_layer_travel_acceleration.label: Initial layer travel
initial_layer_travel_acceleration.tooltip: The acceleration of travel of initial layer

inner_wall_acceleration.label: Inner wall
inner_wall_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration of inner walls. 0 means using normal printing acceleration

interface_shells.label: Interface shells
interface_shells.tooltip: Force the generation of solid shells between adjacent materials/volumes. Useful for multi-extruder prints with translucent materials or manual soluble support material

interlocking_beam.label: Use beam interlocking
interlocking_beam.tooltip: Generate interlocking beam structure at the locations where different filaments touch. This improves the adhesion between filaments, especially models printed in different materials.

interlocking_beam_layer_count.label: Interlocking beam layers
interlocking_beam_layer_count.tooltip: The height of the beams of the interlocking structure, measured in number of layers. Less layers is stronger, but more prone to defects.

interlocking_beam_width.label: Interlocking beam width
interlocking_beam_width.tooltip: The width of the interlocking structure beams.

interlocking_boundary_avoidance.label: Interlocking boundary avoidance
interlocking_boundary_avoidance.tooltip: The distance from the outside of a model where interlocking structures will not be generated, measured in cells.

interlocking_depth.label: Interlocking depth
interlocking_depth.tooltip: The distance from the boundary between filaments to generate interlocking structure, measured in cells. Too few cells will result in poor adhesion.

internal_bridge_support_thickness.label: Internal bridge support thickness
internal_bridge_support_thickness.tooltip: When sparse infill density is low, the internal solid infill or internal bridge may have no archor at the end of line. This causes falling and bad quality when printing internal solid infill. When enable this feature, loop paths will be added to the sparse fill of the lower layers for specific thickness, so that better archor can be provided for internal bridge. 0 means disable this feature

internal_solid_infill_line_width.label: Internal solid infill
internal_solid_infill_line_width.tooltip: Line width of internal solid infill

internal_solid_infill_pattern.label: Internal solid infill pattern
internal_solid_infill_pattern.tooltip: Line pattern of internal solid infill. if the detect narrow internal solid infill be enabled, the concentric pattern will be used for the small area.

internal_solid_infill_speed.label: Internal solid infill
internal_solid_infill_speed.tooltip: Speed of internal solid infill, not the top and bottom surface

ironing_direction.label: ironing direction
ironing_direction.tooltip: Angle for ironing, which controls the relative angle between the top surface and ironing

ironing_flow.label: Ironing flow
ironing_flow.tooltip: The amount of material to extrude during ironing. Relative to flow of normal layer height. Too high value results in overextrusion on the surface

ironing_inset.label: Ironing inset
ironing_inset.tooltip: The distance to keep the from the edges of ironing line. 0 means not apply.

ironing_spacing.label: Ironing line spacing
ironing_spacing.tooltip: The distance between the lines of ironing

ironing_type.label: Ironing Type
ironing_type.tooltip: Ironing is using small flow to print on same height of surface again to make flat surface more smooth. This setting controls which layer being ironed

is_infill_first.label: Print infill first
is_infill_first.tooltip: Order of wall/infill. false means print wall first.

layer_change_gcode.label: Layer change G-code
layer_change_gcode.tooltip: This gcode part is inserted at every layer change after lift z

layer_height.label: Layer height
layer_height.tooltip: Slicing height for each layer. Smaller layer height means more accurate and more printing time

line_width.label: Default
line_width.tooltip: Default line width if some line width is set to be zero

long_retractions_when_cut.label: Long retraction when cut(experimental)
long_retractions_when_cut.tooltip: Experimental feature.Retracting and cutting off the filament at a longer distance during changes to minimize purge.While this reduces flush significantly, it may also raise the risk of nozzle clogs or other printing problems.

machine_end_gcode.label: End G-code
machine_end_gcode.tooltip: End G-code when finish the whole printing
machine_end_gcode.default_value:
M104 S0 ; turn off temperature
G28 X0  ; home X axis
M84     ; disable motors

machine_load_filament_time.label: Filament load time
machine_load_filament_time.tooltip: Time to load new filament when switch filament. For statistics only

machine_max_acceleration_e.tooltip: Maximum acceleration of the E axis

machine_max_acceleration_x.tooltip: Maximum acceleration of the X axis

machine_max_acceleration_y.tooltip: Maximum acceleration of the Y axis

machine_max_acceleration_z.tooltip: Maximum acceleration of the Z axis

machine_max_jerk_e.tooltip: Maximum jerk of the E axis

machine_max_jerk_x.tooltip: Maximum jerk of the X axis

machine_max_jerk_y.tooltip: Maximum jerk of the Y axis

machine_max_jerk_z.tooltip: Maximum jerk of the Z axis

machine_pause_gcode.label: Pause G-code
machine_pause_gcode.tooltip: This G-code will be used as a code for the pause print. User can insert pause G-code in gcode viewer

machine_start_gcode.label: Start G-code
machine_start_gcode.tooltip: Start G-code when start the whole printing
machine_start_gcode.default_value: G28 ; home all axes\nG1 Z5 F5000 ; lift nozzle\n

machine_switch_extruder_time.label: Extruder switch time
machine_switch_extruder_time.tooltip: Time to switch extruder. For statistics only

machine_unload_filament_time.label: Filament unload time
machine_unload_filament_time.tooltip: Time to unload old filament when switch filament. For statistics only

master_extruder_id.label: Master extruder id
master_extruder_id.tooltip: Default extruder id to place filament

max_bridge_length.label: Max bridge length
max_bridge_length.tooltip: Max length of bridges that don't need support. Set it to 0 if you want all bridges to be supported, and set it to a very large value if you don't want any bridges to be supported.

max_layer_height.label: Max
max_layer_height.tooltip: The largest printable layer height for extruder. Used to limit the maximum layer height when enable adaptive layer height

max_travel_detour_distance.label: Avoid crossing wall - Max detour length
max_travel_detour_distance.tooltip: Maximum detour distance for avoiding crossing wall. Don't detour if the detour distance is larger than this value. Detour length could be specified either as an absolute value or as percentage (for example 50%) of a direct travel path. Zero to disable

min_bead_width.label: Minimum wall width
min_bead_width.tooltip: Width of the wall that will replace thin features (according to the Minimum feature size) of the model. If the Minimum wall width is thinner than the thickness of the feature, the wall will become as thick as the feature itself. It's expressed as a percentage over nozzle diameter

min_feature_size.label: Minimum feature size
min_feature_size.tooltip: Minimum thickness of thin features. Model features that are thinner than this value will not be printed, while features thicker than the Minimum feature size will be widened to the Minimum wall width. It's expressed as a percentage over nozzle diameter

min_layer_height.label: Min
min_layer_height.tooltip: The lowest printable layer height for extruder. Used to limit the minimum layer height when enable adaptive layer height

minimum_sparse_infill_area.label: Minimum sparse infill threshold
minimum_sparse_infill_area.tooltip: Sparse infill area which is smaller than threshold value is replaced by internal solid infill

mmu_segmented_region_interlocking_depth.label: Interlocking depth of a segmented region
mmu_segmented_region_interlocking_depth.tooltip: Interlocking depth of a segmented region. Zero disables this feature.

mmu_segmented_region_max_width.label: Maximum width of a segmented region
mmu_segmented_region_max_width.tooltip: Maximum width of a segmented region. Zero disables this feature.

nozzle_temperature.label: Other layers
nozzle_temperature.tooltip: Nozzle temperature for layers after the initial one

nozzle_temperature_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
nozzle_temperature_initial_layer.tooltip: Nozzle temperature to print initial layer when using this filament

nozzle_type.label: Nozzle type
nozzle_type.tooltip: The metallic material of nozzle. This determines the abrasive resistance of nozzle, and what kind of filament can be printed

nozzle_volume.label: Nozzle volume
nozzle_volume.tooltip: Volume of nozzle between the cutter and the end of nozzle

only_one_wall_first_layer.label: Only one wall on first layer
only_one_wall_first_layer.tooltip: Use only one wall on the first layer of model

other_layers_print_sequence_nums.label: The number of other layers print sequence

outer_wall_acceleration.label: Outer wall
outer_wall_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration of outer wall. Using a lower value can improve quality

outer_wall_speed.label: Outer wall
outer_wall_speed.tooltip: Speed of outer wall which is outermost and visible. It's used to be slower than inner wall speed to get better quality.

overhang_fan_speed.label: Fan speed for overhang
overhang_fan_speed.tooltip: Force part cooling fan to be at this speed when printing bridge or overhang wall which has large overhang degree. Forcing cooling for overhang and bridge can get better quality for these part

overhang_fan_threshold.label: Cooling overhang threshold
overhang_fan_threshold.tooltip: Force cooling fan to be specific speed when overhang degree of printed part exceeds this value. Expressed as percentage which indicides how much width of the line without support from lower layer. 0% means forcing cooling for all outer wall no matter how much overhang degree

overhang_threshold_participating_cooling.label: Overhang threshold for participating cooling
overhang_threshold_participating_cooling.tooltip: Decide which overhang part join the cooling function to slow down the speed.Expressed as percentage which indicides how much width of the line without support from lower layer. 100% means forcing cooling for all outer wall no matter how much overhang degree

overhang_totally_speed.tooltip: Speed of 100% overhang wall which has 0 overlap with the lower layer.

physical_extruder_map.label: Map the logical extruder to physical extruder
physical_extruder_map.tooltip: Map the logical extruder to physical extruder

post_process.label: Post-processing Scripts
post_process.tooltip: If you want to process the output G-code through custom scripts, just list their absolute paths here. Separate multiple scripts with a semicolon. Scripts will be passed the absolute path to the G-code file as the first argument, and variables of settings also can be read

pre_start_fan_time.label: Pre start fan time
pre_start_fan_time.tooltip: Force fan start early(0-5 second) when encountering overhangs. This is because the fan needs time to physically increase its speed.

precise_z_height.label: Precise Z height
precise_z_height.tooltip: Enable this to get precise z height of object after slicing. It will get the precise object height by fine-tuning the layer heights of the last few layers. Note that this is an experimental parameter.

preset_names.label: Printer preset names
preset_names.tooltip: Names of presets related to the physical printer

pressure_advance.label: Pressure advance
pressure_advance.tooltip: Pressure advance(Klipper) AKA Linear advance factor(Marlin). Useless for Bambu Printer

prime_tower_brim_width.label: Brim width
prime_tower_brim_width.tooltip: Brim width of prime tower, negative number means auto calculated width based on the height of prime tower.

prime_tower_enable_framework.label: Internal ribs
prime_tower_enable_framework.tooltip: Enable internal ribs to increase the stability of the prime tower.

prime_tower_extra_rib_length.label: Extra rib length
prime_tower_extra_rib_length.tooltip: Positive values can increase the size of the rib wall, while negative values can reduce the size.However, the size of the rib wall can not be smaller than that determined by the cleaning volume.

prime_tower_fillet_wall.label: Fillet wall
prime_tower_fillet_wall.tooltip: The wall of prime tower will fillet

prime_tower_max_speed.label: Max speed
prime_tower_max_speed.tooltip: The maximum printing speed on the prime tower excluding ramming.

prime_tower_rib_wall.label: Rib wall
prime_tower_rib_wall.tooltip: The wall of prime tower will add four ribs

prime_tower_skip_points.label: Skip points
prime_tower_skip_points.tooltip: The wall of prime tower will skip the start points of wipe path

print_flow_ratio.label: Object flow ratio
print_flow_ratio.tooltip: The flow ratio set by object, the meaning is the same as flow ratio.

print_host.label: Hostname, IP or URL
print_host.tooltip: Slic3r can upload G-code files to a printer host. This field should contain the hostname, IP address or URL of the printer host instance. Print host behind HAProxy with basic auth enabled can be accessed by putting the user name and password into the URL in the following format: https://username:password@your-octopi-address/

print_host_webui.label: Device UI
print_host_webui.tooltip: Specify the URL of your device user interface if it's not same as print_host

print_sequence.label: Print sequence
print_sequence.tooltip: Print sequence, layer by layer or object by object

printable_height.label: Printable height
printable_height.tooltip: Maximum printable height which is limited by mechanism of printer

printer_notes.label: Printer notes
printer_notes.tooltip: You can put your notes regarding the printer here.

printer_structure.label: Printer structure
printer_structure.tooltip: The physical arrangement and components of a printing device

printhost_apikey.label: API Key / Password
printhost_apikey.tooltip: Slic3r can upload G-code files to a printer host. This field should contain the API Key or the password required for authentication.

printhost_cafile.label: HTTPS CA File
printhost_cafile.tooltip: Custom CA certificate file can be specified for HTTPS OctoPrint connections, in crt/pem format. If left blank, the default OS CA certificate repository is used.

printhost_ssl_ignore_revoke.label: Ignore HTTPS certificate revocation checks
printhost_ssl_ignore_revoke.tooltip: Ignore HTTPS certificate revocation checks in case of missing or offline distribution points. One may want to enable this option for self signed certificates if connection fails.

printing_by_object_gcode.label: Between Object Gcode
printing_by_object_gcode.tooltip: Insert Gcode between objects. This parameter will only come into effect when you print your models object by object

process_notes.label: Process notes
process_notes.tooltip: You can put your notes regarding the process here.

raft_contact_distance.label: Raft contact Z distance
raft_contact_distance.tooltip: Z gap between object and raft. Ignored for soluble interface

raft_expansion.label: Raft expansion
raft_expansion.tooltip: Expand all raft layers in XY plane

raft_first_layer_density.label: Initial layer density
raft_first_layer_density.tooltip: Density of the first raft or support layer

raft_first_layer_expansion.label: Initial layer expansion
raft_first_layer_expansion.tooltip: Expand the first raft or support layer to improve bed plate adhesion

raft_layers.label: Raft layers
raft_layers.tooltip: Object will be raised by this number of support layers. Use this function to avoid warping when print ABS

reduce_crossing_wall.label: Avoid crossing wall
reduce_crossing_wall.tooltip: Detour and avoid traveling across wall which may cause blob on surface

reduce_fan_stop_start_freq.label: Keep fan always on
reduce_fan_stop_start_freq.tooltip: If enable this setting, part cooling fan will never be stopped and will run at least at minimum speed to reduce the frequency of starting and stopping

reduce_infill_retraction.label: Reduce infill retraction
reduce_infill_retraction.tooltip: Don't retract when the travel is in infill area absolutely. That means the oozing can't been seen. This can reduce times of retraction for complex model and save printing time, but make slicing and G-code generating slower

required_nozzle_HRC.label: Required nozzle HRC
required_nozzle_HRC.tooltip: Minimum HRC of nozzle required to print the filament. Zero means no checking of nozzle's HRC.

resolution.label: Resolution
resolution.tooltip: G-code path is generated after simplifying the contour of model to avoid too many points and gcode lines in the gcode file. Smaller value means higher resolution and more time to slice

retract_before_wipe.label: Retract amount before wipe
retract_before_wipe.tooltip: The length of fast retraction before wipe, relative to retraction length

retract_lift_above.label: Z hop lower boundary
retract_lift_above.tooltip: Z hop will only come into effect when Z is above this value and is below the parameter: "Z hop upper boundary"

retract_lift_below.label: Z hop upper boundary
retract_lift_below.tooltip: If this value is positive, Z hop will only come into effect when Z is above the parameter: "Z hop lower boundary" and is below this value

retract_when_changing_layer.label: Retract when change layer
retract_when_changing_layer.tooltip: Force a retraction when changes layer

retraction_distances_when_cut.label: Retraction distance when cut
retraction_distances_when_cut.tooltip: Experimental feature.Retraction length before cutting off during filament change

retraction_length.label: Length
retraction_length.tooltip: Some amount of material in extruder is pulled back to avoid ooze during long travel. Set zero to disable retraction

retraction_minimum_travel.label: Travel distance threshold
retraction_minimum_travel.tooltip: Only trigger retraction when the travel distance is longer than this threshold

role_base_wipe_speed.label: Role-based wipe speed
role_base_wipe_speed.tooltip: The wipe speed is determined by speed of current extrusion role. e.g if a wipe action is executed immediately following an outer wall extrusion, the speed of the outer wall extrusion will be utilized for the wipe action.

scan_first_layer.label: Scan first layer
scan_first_layer.tooltip: Enable this to enable the camera on printer to check the quality of first layer

scarf_angle_threshold.label: Scarf application angle threshold
scarf_angle_threshold.tooltip:
This option sets the threshold angle for applying a conditional scarf joint seam.
If the seam angle within the perimeter loop exceeds this value (indicating the absence of sharp corners), a scarf joint seam will be used. The default value is 155°.

seam_gap.label: Seam gap
seam_gap.tooltip:
In order to reduce the visibility of the seam in a closed loop extrusion, the loop is interrupted and shortened by a specified amount.
This amount as a percentage of the current extruder diameter. The default value for this parameter is 15

seam_position.label: Seam position
seam_position.tooltip: The start position to print each part of outer wall

seam_slope_conditional.label: Smart scarf seam application
seam_slope_conditional.tooltip: Apply scarf joints only to smooth perimeters where traditional seams do not conceal the seams at sharp corners effectively.

seam_slope_entire_loop.label: Scarf around entire wall
seam_slope_entire_loop.tooltip: The scarf extends to the entire length of the wall.

seam_slope_inner_walls.label: Scarf joint for inner walls
seam_slope_inner_walls.tooltip: Use scarf joint for inner walls as well.

seam_slope_steps.label: Scarf steps
seam_slope_steps.tooltip: Minimum number of segments of each scarf.

silent_mode.label: Supports silent mode
silent_mode.tooltip: Whether the machine supports silent mode in which machine use lower acceleration to print

skirt_distance.label: Skirt distance
skirt_distance.tooltip: Distance from skirt to brim or object

skirt_height.label: Skirt height
skirt_height.tooltip: How many layers of skirt. Usually only one layer

skirt_loops.label: Skirt loops
skirt_loops.tooltip: Number of loops for the skirt. Zero means disabling skirt

slice_closing_radius.label: Slice gap closing radius
slice_closing_radius.tooltip: Cracks smaller than 2x gap closing radius are being filled during the triangle mesh slicing. The gap closing operation may reduce the final print resolution, therefore it is advisable to keep the value reasonably low.

slicing_mode.label: Slicing Mode
slicing_mode.tooltip: Use "Even-odd" for 3DLabPrint airplane models. Use "Close holes" to close all holes in the model.

slow_down_for_layer_cooling.label: Slow printing down for better layer cooling
slow_down_for_layer_cooling.tooltip: Enable this option to slow printing speed down to make the final layer time not shorter than the layer time threshold in "Max fan speed threshold", so that layer can be cooled for a longer time. This can improve the cooling quality for needle and small details

slow_down_layer_time.label: Layer time
slow_down_layer_time.tooltip: The printing speed in exported gcode will be slowed down, when the estimated layer time is shorter than this value, to get better cooling for these layers

slow_down_min_speed.label: Min print speed
slow_down_min_speed.tooltip: The minimum printing speed when slow down for cooling

small_perimeter_speed.label: Small perimeters
small_perimeter_speed.tooltip: This setting will affect the speed of perimeters having radius <= small perimeter threshold(usually holes). If expressed as percentage (for example: 80%) it will be calculated onthe outer wall speed setting above. Set to zero for auto.

small_perimeter_threshold.label: Small perimter threshold
small_perimeter_threshold.tooltip: This sets the threshold for small perimeter length. Default threshold is 0mm

smooth_coefficient.label: Smooth coefficient
smooth_coefficient.tooltip: The smaller the number, the longer the speed transition path. 0 means not apply.

smooth_speed_discontinuity_area.label: Smooth speed discontinuity area
smooth_speed_discontinuity_area.tooltip: Add the speed transition between discontinuity area.

sparse_infill_acceleration.label: Sparse infill
sparse_infill_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration of sparse infill. If the value is expressed as a percentage (e.g. 100%), it will be calculated based on the default acceleration.

sparse_infill_anchor.label: Length of sparse infill anchor
sparse_infill_anchor.tooltip: Connect a sparse infill line to an internal perimeter with a short segment of an additional perimeter. If expressed as percentage (example: 15%) it is calculated over sparse infill line width. Slicer tries to connect two close infill lines to a short perimeter segment. If no such perimeter segment shorter than infill_anchor_max is found, the infill line is connected to a perimeter segment at just one side and the length of the perimeter segment taken is limited to this parameter, but no longer than anchor_length_max. Set this parameter to zero to disable anchoring perimeters connected to a single infill line.

sparse_infill_anchor_max.label: Maximum length of sparse infill anchor
sparse_infill_anchor_max.tooltip: Connect a sparse infill line to an internal perimeter with a short segment of an additional perimeter. If expressed as percentage (example: 15%) it is calculated over sparse infill line width. Slicer tries to connect two close infill lines to a short perimeter segment. If no such perimeter segment shorter than this parameter is found, the infill line is connected to a perimeter segment at just one side and the length of the perimeter segment taken is limited to infill_anchor, but no longer than this parameter. Set this parameter to zero to disable anchoring.

sparse_infill_density.label: Sparse infill density
sparse_infill_density.tooltip: Density of internal sparse infill, 100% means solid throughout

sparse_infill_filament.label: Infill
sparse_infill_filament.tooltip: Filament to print internal sparse infill.

sparse_infill_line_width.label: Sparse infill
sparse_infill_line_width.tooltip: Line width of internal sparse infill

sparse_infill_pattern.label: Sparse infill pattern
sparse_infill_pattern.tooltip: Line pattern for internal sparse infill

spiral_mode.label: Spiral vase
spiral_mode.tooltip: Spiralize smooths out the z moves of the outer contour. And turns a solid model into a single walled print with solid bottom layers. The final generated model has no seam

spiral_mode_max_xy_smoothing.label: Max XY Smoothing
spiral_mode_max_xy_smoothing.tooltip: Maximum distance to move points in XY to try to achieve a smooth spiralIf expressed as a %, it will be computed over nozzle diameter

spiral_mode_smooth.label: Smooth Spiral
spiral_mode_smooth.tooltip: Smooth Spiral smoothes out X and Y moves as wellresulting in no visible seam at all, even in the XY directions on walls that are not vertical

start_end_points.label: Start end points
start_end_points.tooltip: The start and end points which are from cutter area to garbage can.

supertack_plate_temp.label: Other layers
supertack_plate_temp.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers except the initial one. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the Cool Plate

supertack_plate_temp_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
supertack_plate_temp_initial_layer.tooltip: Bed temperature of the initial layer. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the Bambu Cool Plate SuperTack

support_air_filtration.label: Air filtration enhancement
support_air_filtration.tooltip: Enable this if printer support air filtration enhancement.

support_angle.label: Pattern angle
support_angle.tooltip: Use this setting to rotate the support pattern on the horizontal plane.

support_bottom_interface_spacing.label: Bottom interface spacing
support_bottom_interface_spacing.tooltip: Spacing of bottom interface lines. Zero means solid interface

support_bottom_z_distance.label: Bottom Z distance
support_bottom_z_distance.tooltip: The z gap between the bottom support interface and object

support_chamber_temp_control.label: Support control chamber temperature
support_chamber_temp_control.tooltip: This option is enabled if machine support controlling chamber temperature

support_critical_regions_only.label: Support critical regions only
support_critical_regions_only.tooltip: Only create support for critical regions including sharp tail, cantilever, etc.

support_expansion.label: Normal Support expansion
support_expansion.tooltip: Expand (+) or shrink (-) the horizontal span of normal support

support_filament.label: Support/raft base
support_filament.tooltip: Filament to print support base and raft. "Default" means no specific filament for support and current filament is used

support_interface_filament.label: Support/raft interface
support_interface_filament.tooltip: Filament to print support interface. "Default" means no specific filament for support interface and current filament is used

support_interface_loop_pattern.label: Interface use loop pattern
support_interface_loop_pattern.tooltip: Cover the top contact layer of the supports with loops. Disabled by default.

support_interface_not_for_body.label: Avoid interface filament for base
support_interface_not_for_body.tooltip: Avoid using support interface filament to print support base if possible.

support_interface_pattern.label: Interface pattern
support_interface_pattern.tooltip: Line pattern of support interface. Default pattern for support interface is Rectilinear Interlaced

support_interface_spacing.label: Top interface spacing
support_interface_spacing.tooltip: Spacing of interface lines. Zero means solid interface

support_object_first_layer_gap.label: Support/object first layer gap
support_object_first_layer_gap.tooltip: XY separation between an object and its support at the first layer.

support_object_xy_distance.label: Support/object xy distance
support_object_xy_distance.tooltip: XY separation between an object and its support

support_on_build_plate_only.label: On build plate only
support_on_build_plate_only.tooltip: Don't create support on model surface, only on build plate

support_remove_small_overhang.label: Remove small overhangs
support_remove_small_overhang.tooltip: Remove small overhangs that possibly need no supports.

support_style.label: Style
support_style.tooltip:
Style and shape of the support. For normal support, projecting the supports into a regular grid will create more stable supports (default), while snug support towers will save material and reduce object scarring.
For tree support, slim style will merge branches more aggressively and save a lot of material, strong style will make larger and stronger support structure and use more materials, while hybrid style is the combination of slim tree and normal support with normal nodes under large flat overhangs. Organic style will produce more organic shaped tree structure and less interfaces which makes it easer to be removed. The default style is organic tree for most cases, and hybrid tree if adaptive layer height or soluble interface is enabled.

support_threshold_angle.label: Threshold angle
support_threshold_angle.tooltip: Support will be generated for overhangs whose slope angle is below the threshold.

support_top_z_distance.label: Top Z distance
support_top_z_distance.tooltip: The z gap between the top support interface and object

support_type.label: Type
support_type.tooltip: normal(auto) and tree(auto) is used to generate support automatically. If normal(manual) or tree(manual) is selected, only support enforcers are generated

symmetric_infill_y_axis.label: Symmetric infill y axis
symmetric_infill_y_axis.tooltip: If the model has two parts that are symmetric about the y-axis, and you want these parts to have symmetric textures, please click this option on one of the parts.

temperature_vitrification.label: Softening temperature
temperature_vitrification.tooltip: The material softens at this temperature, so when the bed temperature is equal to or greater than it, it's highly recommended to open the front door and/or remove the upper glass to avoid cloggings.

template_custom_gcode.label: Custom G-code
template_custom_gcode.tooltip: This G-code will be used as a custom code

textured_plate_temp.label: Other layers
textured_plate_temp.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers except the initial one. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the Textured PEI Plate

textured_plate_temp_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
textured_plate_temp_initial_layer.tooltip: Bed temperature of the initial layer. Value 0 means the filament does not support to print on the Textured PEI Plate

thick_bridges.label: Thick bridges
thick_bridges.tooltip: If enabled, bridges are more reliable, can bridge longer distances, but may look worse. If disabled, bridges look better but are reliable just for shorter bridged distances.

thumbnail_size.label: Thumbnail size
thumbnail_size.tooltip: Decides the size of thumbnail stored in gcode files

timelapse_type.label: Timelapse
timelapse_type.tooltip: If smooth or traditional mode is selected, a timelapse video will be generated for each print. After each layer is printed, a snapshot is taken with the chamber camera. All of these snapshots are composed into a timelapse video when printing completes. If smooth mode is selected, the toolhead will move to the excess chute after each layer is printed and then take a snapshot. Since the melt filament may leak from the nozzle during the process of taking a snapshot, prime tower is required for smooth mode to wipe nozzle.

top_area_threshold.label: Top area threshold
top_area_threshold.tooltip: The min width of top areas in percentage of perimeter line width.

top_color_penetration_layers.label: Top paint penetration layers
top_color_penetration_layers.tooltip: This is  the number of layers of top paint penetration.

top_one_wall_type.label: Only one wall on top surfaces
top_one_wall_type.tooltip: Use only one wall on flat top surface, to give more space to the top infill pattern. Could be applied on topmost surface or all top surface.

top_shell_layers.label: Top shell layers
top_shell_layers.tooltip: This is the number of solid layers of top shell, including the top surface layer. When the thickness calculated by this value is thinner than top shell thickness, the top shell layers will be increased

top_shell_thickness.label: Top shell thickness
top_shell_thickness.tooltip: The number of top solid layers is increased when slicing if the thickness calculated by top shell layers is thinner than this value. This can avoid having too thin shell when layer height is small. 0 means that this setting is disabled and thickness of top shell is absolutely determained by top shell layers

top_solid_infill_flow_ratio.label: Top surface flow ratio
top_solid_infill_flow_ratio.tooltip: This factor affects the amount of material for top solid infill. You can decrease it slightly to have smooth surface finish

top_surface_acceleration.label: Top surface
top_surface_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration of top surface infill. Using a lower value may improve top surface quality

top_surface_pattern.label: Top surface pattern
top_surface_pattern.tooltip: Line pattern of top surface infill

top_surface_speed.label: Top surface
top_surface_speed.tooltip: Speed of top surface infill which is solid

travel_acceleration.label: Travel
travel_acceleration.tooltip: The acceleration of travel except initial layer

travel_speed.label: Travel
travel_speed.tooltip: Speed of travel which is faster and without extrusion

tree_support_branch_angle.label: Branch angle
tree_support_branch_angle.tooltip: This setting determines the maximum overhang angle that t he branches of tree support allowed to make.If the angle is increased, the branches can be printed more horizontally, allowing them to reach farther.

tree_support_branch_diameter.label: Branch diameter
tree_support_branch_diameter.tooltip: This setting determines the initial diameter of support nodes.

tree_support_branch_diameter_angle.label: Branch diameter angle
tree_support_branch_diameter_angle.tooltip: The angle of the branches' diameter as they gradually become thicker towards the bottom. An angle of 0 will cause the branches to have uniform thickness over their length. A bit of an angle can increase stability of the tree support.

tree_support_branch_distance.label: Branch distance
tree_support_branch_distance.tooltip: This setting determines the distance between neighboring tree support nodes.

tree_support_wall_count.label: Support wall loops
tree_support_wall_count.tooltip: This setting specifies the count of support walls in the range of [0,2]. 0 means auto.

use_firmware_retraction.label: Use firmware retraction
use_firmware_retraction.tooltip: Convert the retraction moves to G10 and G11 gcode

use_relative_e_distances.label: Use relative E distances
use_relative_e_distances.tooltip: If your firmware requires relative E values, check this, otherwise leave it unchecked. Must use relative e distance for Bambu printer

vertical_shell_speed.label: Vertical shell speed
vertical_shell_speed.tooltip: Speed for vertical shells with overhang regions. If expressed as percentage (for example: 80%) it will be calculated onthe internal solid infill speed above

wall_distribution_count.label: Wall distribution count
wall_distribution_count.tooltip: The number of walls, counted from the center, over which the variation needs to be spread. Lower values mean that the outer walls don't change in width

wall_generator.label: Wall generator
wall_generator.tooltip: Classic wall generator produces walls with constant extrusion width and for very thin areas is used gap-fill. Arachne engine produces walls with variable extrusion width

wall_loops.label: Wall loops
wall_loops.tooltip: Number of walls of every layer

wall_sequence.label: Order of walls
wall_sequence.tooltip: Print sequence of inner wall and outer wall.

wall_transition_angle.label: Wall transitioning threshold angle
wall_transition_angle.tooltip: When to create transitions between even and odd numbers of walls. A wedge shape with an angle greater than this setting will not have transitions and no walls will be printed in the center to fill the remaining space. Reducing this setting reduces the number and length of these center walls, but may leave gaps or overextrude

wall_transition_filter_deviation.label: Wall transitioning filter margin
wall_transition_filter_deviation.tooltip: Prevent transitioning back and forth between one extra wall and one less. This margin extends the range of extrusion widths which follow to [Minimum wall width - margin, 2 * Minimum wall width + margin]. Increasing this margin reduces the number of transitions, which reduces the number of extrusion starts/stops and travel time. However, large extrusion width variation can lead to under- or overextrusion problems. It's expressed as a percentage over nozzle diameter

wall_transition_length.label: Wall transition length
wall_transition_length.tooltip: When transitioning between different numbers of walls as the part becomes thinner, a certain amount of space is allotted to split or join the wall segments. It's expressed as a percentage over nozzle diameter

wipe.label: Wipe while retracting
wipe.tooltip: Move nozzle along the last extrusion path when retracting to clean leaked material on nozzle. This can minimize blob when printing new part after travel

wipe_distance.label: Wipe Distance
wipe_distance.tooltip: Describe how long the nozzle will move along the last path when retracting

wipe_speed.label: Wipe speed
wipe_speed.tooltip: The wipe speed is determined by the speed setting specified in this configuration.If the value is expressed as a percentage (e.g. 80%), it will be calculated based on the travel speed setting above.The default value for this parameter is 80%

xy_contour_compensation.label: X-Y contour compensation
xy_contour_compensation.tooltip: Contour of object will be grown or shrunk in XY plane by the configured value. Positive value makes contour bigger. Negative value makes contour smaller. This function is used to adjust size slightly when the object has assembling issue

xy_hole_compensation.label: X-Y hole compensation
xy_hole_compensation.tooltip: Holes of object will be grown or shrunk in XY plane by the configured value. Positive value makes holes bigger. Negative value makes holes smaller. This function is used to adjust size slightly when the object has assembling issue

z_direction_outwall_speed_continuous.label: Smoothing wall speed along Z(experimental)
z_direction_outwall_speed_continuous.tooltip: Smoothing outwall speed in z direction to get better surface quality. Print time will increases. It is not work on spiral vase mode.

z_hop.label: Z hop when retract
z_hop.tooltip: Whenever the retraction is done, the nozzle is lifted a little to create clearance between nozzle and the print. It prevents nozzle from hitting the print when travel moves. Using spiral line to lift z can prevent stringing
